page.title: 10COMPUTER AT WORK
page.content:
The saw was built in Sweden,and is controlled by a{computer.}It is the only one of its kind in Britain .
The saw is held up by pillars over a large pit.The saw has four blades. When the log comes in it has to be scanned so the{computer}knows the size.The chipper takes off the rough sides before it is cut.The log has to go through the saw four times before it is completed.Then it goes out to be loaded.
In a dust free cabin which looks at the saw there is a chair with buttons on the arms to control the machinery.It takes one man to operate the{computer.}In the shed there are eight people when there used to be twenty.It does more work than all the other saws in the yard.
